intro: Cupania rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf cupania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its elliptic to ovate leaves with a rounded base. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Cupania rotundifolia is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
